glsa.title: GLib: Execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: Multiple integer overflows might allow for the execution of arbitrary code when performing base64 conversion.

background.p: The GLib is a library of C routines that is used by a multitude of programs.

description.p: Diego E. Petteno` reported multiple integer overflows in glib/gbase64.c when converting a long string from or to a base64 representation.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to perform a base64 conversion via an application using GLib, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
